thread.title: FONTANA: Man died after lying on train tracks, police say
thread.title_full: FONTANA: Man died after lying on train tracks, police say - Press Enterprise

author: ALI TADAYON
title: FONTANA: Man died after lying on train tracks, police say
text:
BY ALI TADAYON / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 10, 2015 Updated: 2:33 p.m. FONTANA: Man died after lying on train tracks, police say Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Related article Â» The 52-year-old man who died Friday, Oct. 9, when he was hit by a train had lay down on the tracks, according to a Fontana Police Department news release.
The crash occurred about 11:40 a.m. on the tracks between Orange Court and Ceres Avenue in Fontana. Witnesses and the train engineer told officers that the man exited a car near Alder Avenue, ran up to the tracks and lay down.
An eastbound Metrolink train hit him.
The 306 line held at the accident site, and passengers were being transported out of the area via buses. The 308 line was also canceled at Fontana.
